title: Stored XSS on www.starbucks.com.sg/careers/career-center/career-landing-*

profile.name: Starbucks
profile.about: Inspiring and nurturing the human spirit -- one person, one cup, one neighborhood at a time.

vulnerability_information: **Summary:** While enumeration of the webpage for Starbucks I observed the following pages. https://www.starbucks.com.sg/careers/career-center/career-landing-5? The webpage have been highly spam by automated scanners or malicious attack. By clicking on any of the pages it would redirect the user to a wordpress website ``` Obat Kebas ``` The owner of the following wordpress pages could manipulate user into redirecting to a Starbucks page for a job offer and an user by clicking on the webpage would redirect to a website of its choosing. {F439338} {F439340} * List any recommendations for bug fix Remove the pages from Starbucks webpage. ## Impact The owner of the following wordpress pages could manipulate user into redirecting to a Starbucks page for a job offer and an user by clicking on the webpage would redirect to a website of its choosing.

activities.message: Website been spam with over 1.5k messages with HTML injection
Clicking on any part of the webpage will redirect.
Hey @13ern - Thanks for the submission. Your report is currently being reviewed and the HackerOne triage team will get back to you once there is additional information to share.
Hi @13ern - Are you able to replicate this HTML injection and can you please provide step-by-step instructions demonstrating how to reproduce it?

@tuxedo basically the guy has deface the entire page I cant even enter the comments. So I am unable to even replicate it  when already the size is  style="z-index:9999999999999999

Let me know if there any other way to report this to Starbucks if H1 is not a acceptable medium. To me this is a security incident. His HTML has even cover the entire comment page.
``` Obat Kebas ... Obat Kebas ``` {F439729} As you can see he has inserted it through the use of comments.

Manage to get XSS working. https://www.starbucks.com.sg/careers/career-center/career-landing-1 I noted that https://www.starbucks.com.sg/careers/career-center/career-landing-2 has already been compromised by stored XSS and I use the same code and modify it for the XSS for landing page 1. POC: ```

Bus Charter Italy


Quality BusService Rome
Quality BusService Verona
Quality BusService Venice
Quality BusService Turin
Quality BusService Pisa
Quality BusService Naples
Quality BusService Palermo

``` The application page is now redirected to hackerone page. I am stopping my test now.
Can we change the report title to Stored XSS on Starbucks Career Page through comments?

Hi @13ern - Thank you for providing the additional information and nice job escalating this bug. I've invited @0xc0ffee to join as a collaborator. Can you also please include clear step-by-step instructions demonstrating how to reproduce this stored XSS?

Hi @tuxedo, thanks for the compliment. Steps to reproduce for Stored XSS: 1. Browse to https://www.starbucks.com.sg/careers/career-center/career-landing-1 2. Click on "Leave a Comment" button 3. Enter the following for the comments field Actual code being used: ```

Bus Charter Italy


Quality BusService Rome
Quality BusService Verona
Quality BusService Venice
Quality BusService Turin
Quality BusService Pisa
Quality BusService Naples
Quality BusService Palermo

``` Modified code for clarity: ```

hackerone

``` The content for the above could be anything. I have modified the payload that someone has used on https://www.starbucks.com.sg/careers/career-center/career-landing-2 4. Enter a dummy value for Name field： Eg. Test 5. Enter a dummy email for Email field： Eg. test@live.com 6. Click on F5 for the page to reload Observe that the page now redirects user who clicks on the link to hackerone webpage. The following video shows that the XSS triggers when a user visits the page and is redirected to Hackerone homepage due to location.href that points to https://hackerone.com {F440057} Affected Webpages: + https://www.starbucks.com.sg/careers/career-center/career-landing-1 + https://www.starbucks.com.sg/careers/career-center/career-landing-2 + https://www.starbucks.com.sg/careers/career-center/career-landing-3 + https://www.starbucks.com.sg/careers/career-center/career-landing-4 + https://www.starbucks.com.sg/careers/career-center/career-landing-5 + https://www.starbucks.com.sg/careers/career-center/career-landing-6 Impact: Anyone who browses the webpage would be point to the attacker webpage of his choosing by HREF or cookie stealing.

additional_data.old_title: https://www.starbucks.com.sg/careers/career-center/career-landing-5? - URL redirection by comments ( Been compromised )

activities.message: Thanks @tuxedo

Thank you @13ern! I was able to validate your report and have submitted it to the appropriate remediation team for review. They will let us know the final ruling on this report, and if/when a fix will be implemented. Please note that the status and severity are subject to change.

Hi @tuxedo, just to check is there any updates from Starbucks end?

Thank you

Hi,
It has been awhile that the report is stuck at "New" just to check if there is any updates? 
I have also noted that the issues still persist on Starbucks website.
Thank you

Did a CVSS calculation
Would like to point out that the page itself is a Career portal page. Hence with a stored XSS it is more susceptible to conduct a phishing attack by redirecting user to a fake Starbucks recruitment page for malicious attack or collecting of PII information.
CVSS: 8.2 High 
https://www.first.org/cvss/calculator/3.0#CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:L/A:H

Hi,
Would like to check is there any updates? 

Thank you

Hi guys, 

I believe the avg time to triage is 2 days and and the report is hanging on "new" status for like a month.
Would be lovely if you guys could help to take a look at the report and it status.

Thank you

Hi @13ern,

Thank you for your patience on this one! We apologize for the delay in getting this to a triaged state. I have confirmed the issue and forwarded the details along to our partners in Singapore for resolution. We'll provide an update as soon as we have more information on the status of a fix.

Thanks!
@shadegrown
Thanks for the update @shadegrown

Hi  Starbucks and @shadegrown, 
Thanks for the bounty and really appreciate the bonus
@tuxedo could I have split 5% of the bounty for @0xc0ffee 

Thank you
*I would like to give 5% of the bounty to @0xc0ffee hope this clear up the confusion

Hi @13ern,

I just got notification from the team working on this that the issue has been resolved. I retested and confirmed that the vulnerable pages have been taken down and are no longer publicly accessible. Thank you again for the report. We look forward to seeing more submissions from you in the future!

Thanks,
@shadegrown
